remarks: The opposite of a group sum is the same as the original.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Apr-2016.)  Obsolete version of ~ gsumzoppg as of 6-Jun-2019.  (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
statement:
gsumzoppgOLD.b $e |- B = ( Base ` G ) $.
gsumzoppgOLD.0 $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` G ) $.
gsumzoppgOLD.z $e |- Z = ( Cntz ` G ) $.
gsumzoppgOLD.o $e |- O = ( oppG ` G ) $.
gsumzoppgOLD.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. Mnd ) $.
gsumzoppgOLD.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. V ) $.
gsumzoppgOLD.f $e |- ( ph -> F : A --> B ) $.
gsumzoppgOLD.c $e |- ( ph -> ran F C_ ( Z ` ran F ) ) $.
gsumzoppgOLD.n $e |- ( ph -> ( `' F " ( _V \ { .0. } ) ) e. Fin ) $.
gsumzoppgOLD $p |- ( ph -> ( O gsum F ) = ( G gsum F ) ) $.
